32.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006.
32.title: "Ensnared!"
32.author: story, Rich Margopoulos ; art, Alex Toth
notes: "You are anywhere. And then you are in a boxlike room. There is no one there. There is no escape. You're trapped. You hammer at the locked exit and plead, 'Someone let me out!' And then, to your horror, somebody opens the door!"

59.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006.
59.title: "The Killing"
59.author: author, Roger McKenzie ; illustrators, Leo Duranona and Alex Toth
notes: "War ravaged the land! Wounds bleed as General Sherman led his troops to the sea. There were so many lives yet to avenge!"

60.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006.
60.title: "Kui"
60.author: story & art, Alex Toth
notes: "The plane splashed into the ocean. Waves parted gracefully and it was on the beach, shining silver in the tropical sun. Then he and Louise climbed out and began their long ascent, to find the legendary Kui, cursed temple of the inaccessible god!"

63.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006.
63.title: "Malphisto's Illusion"
63.author: author, Nicola Cuti ; illustrators, Alexis Romeo and Alex Toth
notes: "Malphisto's magic show was so ordinary and so obvious! Every trick in the show was old hat except one. The decapitation trick was so utterly perfect and horrifyingly chilling that it had to be real!"
Contents page title: "Illusion."

74.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006.
74.title: "Phantom of Pleasure Island"
74.author: story, Gerry Boudreau ; art, Alex Toth
notes: "They called it Pleasure Island. An amusement park. If you consider murder amusing. A little girl sprawled in the midway, a bullet through her head. A honeymooning couple cut to ribbons. No pattern. No clues. Senseless slaughter. Who's the Phantom of fun-land murder?"

77.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006.
77.title: "Proof Positive"
77.author: story and art, Alex Toth

"Barton Dix, photographer, had invented an astounding new process. Planning to steal his invention, thieves demanded a demonstration. And got more than they bargained for!"

Title reads "Unreel," changed by the artist to "Unreal."

131.heading: Toth, Alex, 1928-2006--Miscellanea.
131.title: "Eight Top Creators Petition Innovation : False Light Advertising Claimed"
131.author: Greg S
131.appears_in: Baisden. p. 16-19 in The Comics Journal, no. 130 (July 1989)
notes: Begins: "Terry Austin, John Byrne, Howard Chaykin, John Jay Muth, Trina Robbins, P. Craig Russell, Alex Toth, and Charles Vess have formally complained to Innovation Comics about advertisements they claim misrepresent them as Innovation freelancers." A published ad showing the cover of Voyages, and listing its contributors, was for an Innovation reissue of a 1983 book (published by Nautilus Dreams), and the reissue didn't actually appear. Paul Curtis responds for Innovation.
